title: Business Live: New Look goes out of fashion - BBC News
summary: new look to close 60 stores and cut 1,000 jobs .
sales slide at the restaurant group .
ofgem moves to cut energy bills .
advertising watchdog cracks down on ticket resellers .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's it for the midweek business live - thank you for joining us .
we 'll be back tomorrow morning at 06:00 for all the latest news , views and analysis from the world of business .
do join us then if you can .

documents.title: france warns firms on equal pay
text: the french government has warned firms with more than 50 employees that under new plans , they would have three years to eradicate unjustified pay gaps between men and women .
those who fail to do so could face fines of up to 1 % of the company 's wage bill .
french men on average are paid 9 % more than women for the same work , even though equal pay laws have been in force for nearly half a century .
employers have been given a month to respond to the proposals .
back in november 2016 , some 200 to 300 people demonstrated in paris for equal pay between men and women ( see
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: mixed as wall street closes
text: as far as the main indexes are concerned at the end of wednesday 's trading session , it 's two down , one up , as us investors continue to react to donald trump 's threats of a trade war .
the dow jones ended the day down 82.76 points , or 0.33 % , at 24,801.36 , while the s & p 500 fell 1.32 points , or 0.05 % , to 2,726.80 .
however , the tech-heavy nasdaq composite rose 24.64 points , or 0.33 % , to 7,396.65 .

documents.title: join the conversation
text: we 've set up a new uk facebook group all about affordable living .
from tuition fees , paying off student loans , finding a job , travelling to work , renting and saving for your first home - it 's a space to share your experiences .
join the conversation here :
affordable living , scrap you expensive mobile phone and so as a consequence facebook

documents.title: buyer sought for countrywide farmers
text: a buyer is being sought for agricultural goods retailer countrywide farmers , which has gone into administration ( see earlier post ) .
countrywide directors said with `` significant regret '' the business faces `` a very uncertain future '' .
the company , based in evesham , announced plans to sell in april 2017 , but a potential sale to mole valley farmers ltd fell through in october .

on 1 march , the company announced it had sold its liquefied petroleum gas division to dcc flogas , however its retail business sale to mole valley could not be approved and the competition and markets authority ( cma ) announced an investigation .

countrywide announced it was going into administration as the cma investigation could last up to six months , and the company said it will be `` unable to meet its financial obligations for this extended period of time '' .

documents.title: indian hotel chain to offer ivf
text: india 's biggest hotel chain , taj hotels , has announced plans to help female staff by paying for fertility treatment .
the company said it would reimburse `` expenses for family expansion '' as part of its commitment to promote equal opportunities for women .
it already has paid maternity leave and creche facilities in all its hotels .
the firm is seeking to break `` gender stereotypes '' that force many women to stop work when they have children .
taj hotels said it would pay for `` various medical procedures '' , including ivf treatments and the freezing of eggs , embryos and sperm , as well as artificial insemination .
read full story here

documents.title: white house : some countries could be exempted from tariffs
text: the white house has said canada and mexico , and possibly other countries , may be exempted from planned us import tariffs on steel and aluminum on the basis of national security , according to reuters .

`` we expect that the president will sign something by the end of the week and there are potential carve-outs for mexico and canada based on national security , and possibly other countries as well based on that process , '' white house spokeswoman sarah sanders told journalists .

documents.title: amazon 'working to fix ' alexa 's random laughing
text: over the past few days , users with amazon 's digital assistant alexa-enabled devices have reported hearing strange , unprompted laughter .
amazon has commented on the issue to the technology news website the verge , saying , we 're aware of this and working to fix it . ''
read the story here

documents.title: sony blocks ' video game
text: sony has blocked the publication of a video game designed to teach male players psychological tricks to convince women to date them .
super seducer was scheduled for release on the playstation 4 on tuesday .
the title has been criticised for being sleazy and for promoting `` toxic behaviours and attitudes '' .
sony has limited itself to saying it `` will not be made available '' , but the bbc has confirmed the japanese company banned the title .
read the full story here

documents.title: us jobs market 'tight '
text: companies across the us are reporting a shortage of workers to fill available jobs , and rising wages in many regions , according to the federal reserve central bank .
the findings - contained in the fed 's beige book - increase the case for interest rate rises in the us .
`` across the country , contacts observed persistent labor market tightness and brisk demand for qualified workers , '' the fed reported .
the central bank also said four of its 12 districts saw a `` marked increase '' in steel prices partly because there had been a decline in foreign competition .
president trump has said he plans to impose a 25 % tariff on steel imports .
the beige book is a federal reserve system publication about current economic conditions across the 12 federal reserve districts .

documents.title: wall street down amid trade war fears
text: let 's check up on how us shares are doing now - and wall street 's three key indexes are still down amid fears donald trump will slap tariffs on imported steel and aluminum this week , leading to a global trade war .
on tuesday , mr trump 's economic adviser gary cohn resigned over his opposition to the president 's plans to impose tariffs .
`` there is more of a political worry that has crept back into the market , '' said brent schutte , chief investment strategist at northwestern mutual wealth management .
`` it 's not just the tariffs , but the broader white house changing all those things are undercurrents which are affecting market sentiment in the near-term . ''
the dow jones is at 24,635.42 , a fall of 249 points or 1.00 % .
the s & p 500 is at 2,712.19 , down 16 points or 0.58 % .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq is at 7,361.64 , 10 points or 0.14 % lower .

documents.title: tusk : trade wars not easy to win
text: it 's been a busy day for european union chief , donald tusk .
first the uk 's post-brexit relationship with the eu was exercising him .
now he 's warned donald trump not to go ahead with proposals to impose steep tariffs on imported steel and aluminium .
he said the us president 's stated view that trade wars were good and easy to win was wrong .
he said the opposite was the case , and eu leaders will gather in two weeks to discuss what action to take if the us goes ahead .
mr trump has said that cheap imports - especially from china - undermine american industries and jobs .

documents.title: hammond ends 'negotiating with ourselves '
text: philip hammond 's speech was broadly welcomed by the uk financial services industry .
but city sources tell me there was nothing in this speech that would make banks and insurance companies halt , or even pause , their post-brexit contingency plans .
as one city insider told me : `` so far , we have been negotiating with ourselves .
`` all the chancellor and the pm have done in the last week is to flesh out the position of one of the parties - that 's pretty limited progress . ''
having said that , the eu 's perennial complaint has been that it does n't know what the uk wants .
the prime minister and the chancellor have gone a substantial way to answering that question in the last week .
read simon 's full blog here
author: Simon Jack
BBC Business Editor

documents.title: city of london welcomes chancellor 's speech
text: the financial services sector is a key component of the uk 's trade with the eu and helps balance our goods deficit .
the uk 's position is now much clearer .
london 's global financial hub can not be replicated anywhere else on the continent .
refusing to include financial services as part of a final trade agreement would undoubtedly damage the whole european economy , limiting growth and risking jobs .

fragmentation will mean costs to customers and businesses would rise , access to deep pools of liquidity held in london would decline and the eu 's ties to the world 's leading financial expertise could be severed .
we urge the eu to give their negotiating team flexibility by including financial services as part of a final trade agreement .

documents.title: scots fishermen slam eu call for access
text: scots fishermen slam eu call for access

documents.title: reality check : eu predicts brexit costs for uk
text: reality check : eu predicts brexit costs for uk
author: Chris Morris
Reality Check correspondent, BBC News

documents.title: 'toxic mix ' for new look
text: new look has badly lost its way .
sales have fallen off a cliff .
even online sales were down 15 % in december .
in recent years it focused on younger shoppers but failed to keep up with the likes of asos , boohoo and primark .
it 's also saddled with way too many stores .
it has nearly 600 fashion outlets , an extraordinary number given the rise of online shopping .
and then there 's the debt .
new look is drowning in it .
it currently stands at £ 1.2bn .
in today 's challenging retail environment that 's a pretty toxic mix .
it needs to cut costs and fast as well as revitalise its business .
it 's got its work cut out .
author: Emma Simpson
Business correspondent, BBC News

documents.title: return of roaming ? probably not
text: the end of mobile roaming charges has probably been the single most popular policy to come out of brussels .
gone is that wave of anxiety when you upload a photo to instagram from ibiza or send a hefty attachment from amsterdam .
but could the fear of bill shock return ?

that possibility has been raised after theresa may confirmed that the uk would be leaving the digital single market , which was at the heart of the european commission 's strategy of removing roaming charges for people travelling between eu states .
outside the digital single market , uk mobile operators could in theory opt to reimpose roaming charges .
but just how likely is that ?
read rory 's full blog here
author: Rory Cellan-Jones
Technology correspondent

documents.title: ftse closes ahead
text: the ftse 100 edged up by 11 points or 0.16 % on the day to close at 7,157.84 .
rolls royce notched up the biggest gain on ftse 100 - rising by 11.7 % following its latest results which showed that every division did better than analysts had forecast .
the biggest fall was in communications giant wpp 's shares , which shed 3.9 % .
earlier reports said consumer goods group procter and gamble were going to cut ad agency spending and `` take back control '' of its marketing .
paddy power betfair shares however fell 3.35 % after it lowered its profit guidance for the year .
and nmc health - the biggest private healthcare provider in the united arab emirates - saw its shared drop by 2.5 % following its results .

documents.title: cbi backs chancellor on financial services
text: reaction is coming in to chancellor philip hammond 's speech on financial services .
cbi deptuy director-general josh hardie , said : the chancellor is absolutely right to be leading the fight for the uk 's financial services sector .
trying to forge a new trading relationship with our largest trading partner that does not include financial services is like building a ship with no sails .

it 's fundamental we protect , maintain and develop our world-beating financial services sector - the lifeblood of both the uk 's and the eu 's economies that enables all other sectors to deliver jobs , innovate and grow .
with two thirds of uk financial services jobs being found outside london , all parts of the country succeed when the sector has wind in its sails . ''

documents.title: hammond : eu could do deal with uk on financial services
text: more detail on chancellor philip hammond 's speech now ( see earlier posts ) .
he has told european leaders that it is in the `` mutual interest '' of both the uk and the eu to include financial services in a free trade agreement .
in a speech , mr hammond set out his argument against `` sceptics '' , saying it is possible to reach a deal .
but eu president donald tusk flat out rejected the uk proposals .
the eu 's chief brexit negotiator , michel barnier , has argued that such a deal had never been done before .
but mr hammond said the eu itself tried to include financial services on trade deals with the us and canada .
he said : `` if it could be done with canada or the usa it could be done with the uk . ''
read the full story here

documents.title: watch : tariffs would 'break us commitments in wto'bbc producer tweets
text: jennifer hillman , professor of international trade at georgetown university in washington , used to sit on world trade organisation panel that settles trade disputes and was the us government 's top lawyer on trade policy
she told bbc world metals tariffs would break us commitments at the wto

president trump `` unequivocally putting # tariffs on steel & aluminium is breaking the united states commitment in the @ twitterid - former wto appellate body member @ twitterid of @ twitterid tells @ twitterid
author: BBC World

documents.title: dow jones 'fearful ' of trump 's trade intentions
text: some comment now on the new york financial markets from connor campbell , financial analyst at spreadex .
he said the dow jones was still looking `` pretty fearful of trump 's trade intentions now that gary cohn is gone '' .
`` the dow jones dropped around 150 to 200 points after the bell - obviously a bad start , but far better than the 350 point fall promised by the futures earlier in the day . ''

`` it 'll be interesting to see how the dow behaves as the session goes on ; it has a tendency to save its major movements for the latter stages of the day , with plenty of time for some more trump tweets to send the skittish index over the edge , '' he added .

documents.title: no airbus job losses expected at broughton
text: an airbus uk spokesperson told the bbc that the company did not expect to see any redundancies at its broughton plant .
about 250 employees currently working on the a380 in the uk are likely to be deployed to other projects , including the a350 , they said .

documents.title: wall street falls on cohn resignation
text: the three key us stock indexes opened lower on wednesday - the drop apparently triggered by the resignation of gary cohn , economic adviser to donald trump .
mr cohn opposed the president 's plans to impose tariffs on metals imports .
the dow jones is at 24,735.08 , down 149 points or 0.6 % .
the s & p 500 is at 2,720.73 , down 7 points or -0.27 % .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq is at 7,370.27 , down 2 points or 0.02 % .

documents.title: airbus shake up to 'affect ' 3,700 jobs
text: european planemaker airbus says up to 3,700 positions will be affected by a cut in the production rates for its a380 and a400m plane programmes .

`` at this stage , airbus estimates the maximum impact of these measures will affect up to 3,700 positions at sites across the company 's home countries of france , germany , the united kingdom and spain , '' airbus said in a statement on wednesday .
`` airbus is committed to managing any implications for its workforce in a responsible manner - as already successfully demonstrated on various occasions in the past .
the company is confident that it will be able to propose opportunities to most of the affected employees through programmes which are ramping up , '' it added .
airbus has cut production rates of the a380 - the world 's largest passenger jet - due to weak demand .

documents.title: running late
text: the electricity transmission authority in europe ( entsoe ) has warned that bedside alarms , central heating timers and oven clocks could be running up to six minutes slow - because of power deviations across the continent .
countries as far apart as spain and turkey could have been affected , since mid-january .
it 's the result of a dispute between kosovo and serbia that 's led to a loss of power , meaning that clocks can lose time .
computers and smart phones are not affected .
the authority said one-hundred-and-thirteen gigawatt hours of energy was missing and someone should have to compensate .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: retailer countrywide farmers goes into administration
text: retailer countrywide farmers has gone into administration and administrators are looking for a buyer for all or part of the business .
the worcestershire-based company , employs 735 people and has 48 retail stores supplying a range of farming , equestrian , harvesting and agricultural goods .
it also has a distribution centre in defford .
administrators from kpmg 's restructuring practice said no `` initial redundancies '' had been made .
on 1 march the company completed the sale of its liquefied petroleum gas division and more than 60 staff transferred to new owner dcc flogas .
kpmg said the company had also identified a purchaser for the retail business , but the competition and markets authority ( cma ) referred the process to an in-depth investigation .
david pike , partner at kpmg and joint administrator , said : following the recent cma announcement , the proposed retail transaction can not proceed .

unfortunately , given the significant trading difficulties and cash flow pressures , this has led the directors to consider their options and take the difficult decision to place the company into administration .

documents.title: hammond : collaboration on financial services 'makes sense '
text: chancellor philip hammond said it was vital that financial services were included in any trade deal - to avoid financial instability :
i want to explain why it makes sense for both the uk and the eu , that we continue to collaborate closely on cross border financial services .

i want to challenge the assertion that financial services can not be part of a free trade agreement , to set out why it is in the interest of both the uk and the eu 27 to ensure that eu businesses and citizens can continue to access the uk financial services hub .

documents.title: hammond : all eu trade deals 'unique '
text: it is time to address the sceptics who say a trade deal including financial services can not be done because it has never been done before .
to them , i say : 'every trade deal the eu has ever done has been unique . '
the eu has never negotiated the same arrangement twice .

documents.title: hammond : london 's loss not europe 's gainbbc business editor tweets on philip hammond 's speech
text: implicit promise to eu that london will not become light regulation centre off shore of eu .
saying that uk needs tough regulation to protect uk taxpayers from risk of having large financial centre .
and if you think there is any trust whatsoever amongst eu27 that tories will keep their word & not try to undercut eu on t & cs to obtain competitive advantage , you are sorely mistaken .
eu27 have had enough of uk 'exceptionalism ' and obstructive destructiveness .
expect no favours .
hammond - london 's loss will not be europe 's gain .
new york , singapore and hong kong will win at europe 's expense .
hes probably right , but they are going to kick our arse anyway
it 's london 's loss wherever it goes .

documents.title: hammond : possible to include financial services in trade deal
text: chancellor of the exchequer philip hammond has started delivering a keynote speech in which he is making the case for preferential access for britain 's financial services industry to the single market .
mr hammond says that it is possible to include financial services within a trade deal `` but that it very much in our mutual interests to do so '' .

documents.title: tusk : uk trying to show brexit was right
text: tusk : uk trying to show brexit was right

documents.title: tusk : no ' and mix ' for brexit
text: the european council president , donald tusk , has said the best britain can hope for in its future relationship with the eu is a free trade agreement .
presenting the eu 's draft negotiating guidelines , he said a final deal would be the only one in history that involved loosening rather than strengthening ties .
at a news conference in luxembourg , he said there could be no and mix approach , but the eu would aim for zero tariffs on goods .
mr tusk did not make the same promise for services , a british priority .
he said he was determined to avoid disruption to flights between britain and europe .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: eu lists us products it would tax
text: the european union has outlined how it will react if the united states goes ahead with plans to impose steep tariffs on imports of steel and aluminium .

the bloc 's trade commissioner , cecilia malmstrom , said the eu was considering a list of us products that might be targeted in retaliation - including orange juice , peanut butter , cranberries , steel , industrial products and some types of bourbon whisky .
but she said she still hoped the us tariffs would n't be implemented .
president trump 's proposals have faced domestic as well as international opposition .
his top economic adviser gary cohn has resigned because he disagrees with the plan .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: the stores under threat
text: the new look stores facing closure include marble arch , oxford circus and moorgate in london along with :

aberdeen - bon accord ; beckton ; bolton ( mens ) ; borehamwood ; brynmawr ; burton mens ; cameron toll ; cardiff - queen arcade ; cheshunt ; clevedon ; craigleith ; doncaster ( mens ) ; dundee - wellgate ; exeter ( mens ) ; fleet ; gateshead - team valley ; glasgow - buchanan street ( mens ) ; gorleston ; hanley ( mens ) - intu potteries ; hounslow ( mens ) ; hull - whitefriargate ; keynsham ; kingswood ; leeds - the core shopping centre ; leicester - haymarket ; ; maidenhead ; maidstone mens ; merry hill ( mens ) ; metro centre ( mens ) ; monmouth ; newport ( mens ) ; newton mearns ; north shields ; nottingham ( mens ) ; ocean terminal ; peterbrough bridge street ; pontypool ; portswood ; ramsgate ; reading - broad street ; reading oracle ( mens ) ; rhyl ; romford ( mens ) ; rugby ; shrewsbury ( mens ) ; sidmouth ; stockport - merseyway ; stockton-on-tees ; stratford upon avon - bridge street ; thornaby ; tonypandy ; torquay - union street ; tredegar ; troon ; wallsend ; weston favell ; wigan ( mens ) .

documents.title: trading as normal
text: new look , which is working with deloitte on the restructuring , said creditors will vote on whether to accept the cva on 21 march .
all stores will remain open during the period of the proposal and online sales will be unaffected .
daniel butters , partner at deloitte , said :
the retail trading environment in the uk remains extremely challenging , driven by weaker consumer confidence , the implications of brexit and competition from online channels .
it is important to stress that no stores will close on day one , and employees , suppliers and business rates will continue to be paid on time and in full . ''

documents.title: new look for new look
text: new look has blamed high rents and challenging trading amid a `` difficult retail environment '' for its cva .
it allows a company to abandon unprofitable stores and reduce rents on its remaining outlets .
the retailer aims to close 60 of its 593 uk stores and cut rents and revise lease terms on a further 393 outlets .

documents.title: breakingnew look to close 60 stores
text: new look has announced its company voluntary arrangement ( cva ) .
under the reorganisation 60 stores will close , which is expected to result in 980 job losses .
but the company says it will try to redeploy staff .

alistair mcgeorge , executive chairman of new look , said : `` given our challenged trading performance and over-rented uk store estate , we are having to take tough but necessary actions to reduce our fixed cost base and restore long-term profitability .
we have held constructive discussions with our key landlords and strategic partners and will now seek creditor approval on our cva proposal .
a priority for us is to keep all potentially affected colleagues informed during this difficult time . ''

documents.title: when nme went free
text: nme went free in september 2015 , following in the footsteps of other titles such as time out and the evening standard , in a bid to boost its circulation .
the weekly publication had been selling about 15,000 copies a week , was distributed at stations , shops and student unions across the uk .
its print run increased to 300,000 - but advertising revenues have not been able to bring in enough cash .

documents.title: hollister helps abercrombie
text: it seems there 's some life still remaining in that preppy us clothing retailer abercrombie & fitch .
like-for-like sales rose by a better-than-expected 9 % in the 14 weeks to3 february and were 3 % higher for the full year .
chief executive fran horowitz says 2017 was `` a year of significant progress '' , with its hollister chain notching up sales of just over $ 2bn - 11 % higher than the previous year .
abercrombie 's shares have soared 75 % in the past 12 months and are a further 7 % higher in pre-market trading in new york .

documents.title: tusk : uk and eu will be 'drifting apart '
text: european council president donald tusk is giving a press conference after the eu released draft guidelines about its future relationship with the uk .
economics editor kamal ahmed has been watching .
tusk - `` a and mix approach for a non-member state is out of the question . ''
# brexit
exactly , the british are n't an empire anymore .
they dont set the terms .
is this anything like your own prick and mix approach ?
donald tusk - `` we do n't want to build a wall between the eu and britain .
we want to remain friends and partners , partners that are as close as possible . ''
# brexit
have you always looked like a gerbil ?
so is the # eu now back-tracking on it 's proposal for an internal border between # northernireland and the rest of the # uk or is this just more empty rhetoric ?
# eu27 # eucopresident # junckereu # brexit
funny because he has been going around for last 18 months saying he needs to put barriers between uk and eu .
tusk - but `` we will be drifting apart . ''
trade will not be frictionless or smoother .
it makes trade more complicated and costly for all of us .
# brexit

documents.title: last dance
text: peter robinson , who runs a very splendid music site called popjustice , laments the demise of nme :
bloody hell
appeal to the media : if at all possible can we please avoid asking tony parsons for his thoughts on the matter

( my own thoughts are that nme was really good long after people said it was n't as good as it used to be , and i learned a lot working there , and at the end of the day fair play for trying the free thing instead of just shutting it three years ago . )

the last thing i 'll say on all this is that loads of our favourite magazines and websites are a lot closer to shutting than we all realise , so if you genuinely will be sad to see them go do n't forget to actually buy them or disable adblockers or whatever
fairly certain that was n't the last thing i 'll say on all this
because people have been saying it was n't as good as it used to be for , like , three decades , can you put a sort of date on that ?
i mean that 's sort of the point is n't it ?
it 's not as good as it was when i was either target audience or on their payroll ''
yes , certainly .
but no one thinks it 's been any good for the last few years of freebie hell .
so what 's the latest we can go for , in a contrarian way ?
you know , i think this second-to-last relaunch period was still really good
ok , so the end of the paid bit , up to like 5 years ago ?
and i 'm sure everything after that made some sort of sense , too .
it was a decent reaction to the need to keep the print magazine going .
or is there a big alternative contemporary print success comparison that it is n't ?
i think once they made the decision to go free ( and in the format they chose ) they sort of had to totally surrender themselves to the demands of ad-supported publishing .
probably two or three alternative approaches i guess
yes .
people got cross about them putting jennifer laurence or whatever on the cover , but that 's inevitable .
there was some great writing in the print edition right up until the end of its life as a paid publication - the online content has always been pretty poor in comparison and annoyingly clickbaity .
( i 've only ever glanced at a handful of issues of the free version . )
recent cover stories were often good .
was v v different when it started , with writing that reflected the writing in the mag , not that you 'd guess in 2018
yeah i think the free idea was brave - i do n't have the solution to this but it needed to be distributed way better .
it felt disposable rather than crucial and that was a shame .
i suppose in some ways it 's harder to give something away than to sell it .
definitely brave for time inc to experiment with that sort of title
thanks peter , wise words .
sometimes you just have to try new things .
the nme lives on , just not in print format
distribution has been an issue .
my local hmv is almost an hour away so i could n't get a copy every week , but when i did i enjoyed it .
a lot , lot better than other free magazines .

documents.title: print version of nme to end
text: after this week , there will no longer be a physical version of the music magazine nme .
it was first published in 1952 and was the first british paper to include a singles chart .
this week 's issue of the magazine out on friday will be the final free print edition .
publisher time inc says it will invest in the digital version of the magazine .
nme is one of the most iconic brands in british media , '' said paul cheal , time 's uk boss .
but he adds that the magazine struggled with increasing production costs and a `` very tough print advertising market '' .
`` unfortunately we have now reached a point where the free weekly magazine is no longer financially viable . ''

documents.title: ftse drifts but rolls royce strong
text: the ftse 100 has been bumping around break even so far today .
at the moment it is little changed at 7,148 .
but there 's some eye-catching moves among individual shares .
engineering giant rolls-royce is up almost 13 % .
investors were happy with the latest set of results which showed that every division at rolls did better than analysts were expecting .
the biggest loser on the exchange is nmc health .
you may not have heard of it , but it is the biggest private healthcare provider in the united arab emirates .
shares are down 3.5 % after its latest set of results .
paddy power betfair is down 3.2 % after it lowered its profit guidance for the current year .

documents.title: trump tweets on jobs and trade
text: the president has been tweeting and seems to be justifying his aggressive policy on trade :
from bush 1 to present , our country has lost more than 55,000 factories , 6,000,000 manufacturing jobs and accumulated trade deficits of more than 12 trillion dollars .
last year we had a trade deficit of almost 800 billion dollars .
bad policies & leadership .
must win again !
# maga
o shut up !

even though you have proven to have the most dysfunctional administration in history !
you are one sick man trump !

you 've done nothing , proven nothing except how dysfunctional administration can be and you want the world to think you 're the best president in history .
guess what , we do n't .
by the way , your approval rating is 35 % !
thank you mr president for working so diligently for us !
you have boosted our economy , put americans back to work , and you will be the first president to even address this problem in years !
these countries have had a free ride for years , but not anymore ! !
# fairandbalanced
if you took economics 101 you 'd know what a bad idea this is .
other countries will stop importing any of our products costing thousands of jobs and eventually devaluing the dollar .
can we also bring back typewriters ?
the horse and buggy ?
blockbuster video ?
just to clarify , is bush 1 your name for your wife or your name for stormy daniels ?

they make up so many lies you can not keep up .
we are all winning with your leadership ! ! !

he was n't elected because of his moral compass , he was elected to help restore our country !

got it

documents.title: france takes steps towards privatisation
text: this weekend france will finalise legislation which will allow for a big round of privatisation , the financial times reports .
the first likely candidate is aeroports de paris ( adp ) , the operator of charles de gaulle and orly airports , the report says .
the government owns 50.6 % of adp , worth around €8bn .
stakes in energy firm engie and the state lottery company francaise des jeux could also be up for sale later in the year .

documents.title: new look overhaul 'within days '
text: it 's a brutal time for uk retailers .
last week both toys r us and maplin fell into administration .
restaurant chains have also been closing or cutting back .
fashion chain new look could be the next one to watch .
retail week reports that it will launch a company voluntary arrangement ( cva ) `` within days '' .
it 's been reported that new look wants to slash store rents by up to 60 % and some stores could close altogether .

documents.title: this mortal coil
text: lower life expectancy in the uk has been good for legal & general .
`` people are n't dying quicker but [ the figures ] are n't improving quite as quickly , '' chief financial officer jeff davies said on a conference call for the insurer 's annual results .
`` we are factoring in a slightly lower life expectancy . ''
that at least is slightly better than the phrase `` favourable mortality experience '' l & g uses in its results .
l & g 's pre-tax profit rose to almost £ 2.1bn , helped by a £ 332m release of `` mortality '' reserves set aside for pension payments , due to the slowdown in life expectancy improvements .

documents.title: cold weather payments triggered
text: the recent severe cold snap has triggered bumper payments of £ 50m to help families keep warm .
about two million households are receiving a top-up to benefits called cold weather payment , worth £ 25 a time .
it 's released when the average temperature in a postcode area drops below freezing for seven consecutive days .
the £ 50m payout covers the week from saturday 24 february to friday 2 march .
the highest regional payout was to people in the west midlands , who are getting £ 8m , followed by homes in yorkshire and the humber , at £ 7.5m .
the department for work and pensions now expects total cold weather payments from november to the end of march to exceed £ 90m .
nearly 3 million will have received the money , in some cases several times .
author: Simon Gompertz
BBC personal finance correspondent

documents.title: come fly with me
text: it 's day two of the geneva motor show and bbc business correspondent theo leggett continues to check out the best - and whackiest - new vehicles on display .
this one should fly out of the showrooms pal-v liberty .
first flying car you can actually buy # genevamotorshow

documents.title: carillion bosses 'focused on pay '
text: more on carillion : blackrock managing director amra balic tells mps that the failed construction company 's board seemed more concerned about bumper payouts to executives than focusing on the deterioration of the business .
`` the most recent conversations [ blackrock had ] were around executive pay .
it seems that the board was focusing more , thinking again how to remunerate executives rather than actually what was going on about the business .
`` definitely too much focus at the board level on remuneration . ''

documents.title: argos boss : computer crushes the catalogue
text: argos boss john rogers , who is speaking at the retail week live event in london today , says its online sales are close to breaking through the £ 2bn mark .
almost 60 % of orders are now made online , which he says is a huge shift for the business .
john rogers ceo of sainsburys argos says can deliver to 90 % of households within 4 hours .
other retailers '' might do 1 hour but only reach v small part of the uk # timewars # rwl18
john rogers ceo of @ twitterid remembers the catalogue days & now the move to online as third most visited retailer site # rwl18

documents.title: carillion : investors 'frustrated ' with auditing
text: murdo murchison from kiltearn partners repeats his criticism of the auditing of carillion by kpmg .
`` i 'm extremely frustrated with the audit performance here , '' he said .
he says the tenure of auditors is a broader problem - kpmg had been auditing carillion since 1999 he points out .
mr murchison would also like to see more competition among the big accountancy firms .

documents.title: the price is ( not ) right
text: ticket resellers are under the spotlight on today 's edition of victoria derbyshire .
`` the price you pay at the end needs to be the price you were promised at the beginning . ''
@ asa uk outlines the `` misleading '' secondary ticketing practices which are banned from today .
more :
psychologically you are desperate to get tickets so ticketmaster have you hooked from the outset .
then amazingly in seconds all their tickets have gone but hey you can get them on their 'legitimate ' sister site at inflated prices .
not a scam site but something to investigate
i suggest that ticketmaster `` sell '' vast numbers of tickets to themselves then resell via their get me in website at massively inflated prices .
only explanation i can think of
based in personal experience trying to obtain killers tickets sold out within seconds but amazingly pop up on get me in to which you are then 'guided ' to get me in
do n't use them if you ca n't get tickets through the official sites then you ca n't go to the event these secondary sites are often fake and a total rip off
too simplistic .
the problem is these companies operate unfair practices , it is endemic .
they are allowed to buy tickets up in bulk .
so genuine individuals never get a chance .
problem is too big can ruin music business if ppl do n't buy .
if they sell for fave value then great but far to often they sell for three four times the original price and that is totally out of order
tocketmaster allows companies to buy up in bulk then hosts viagogo who get a cut from the resell of tickets .
our ariana grande men arena ticket cost originally £ 45 was up for sale 5 mins after sales opened and we bought them for £ 100 .
our 2 teenage daughters were desperate to see her .
it was a once in a lifetime christmas present .
ideas not to buy punishes the innocent party .
companies need clamping down .
ticketmaster website redirected us to viagogo straight away from their website 5 mins after sales opened .
tickets for arigrande men arena concert instead of £ 45 cost £ 100/pers .
after the attack we had to fight to get free tickets for the 1 concert with media campaign .
the company millennium travel whose ticket we got from viagogo bought tickets in bulk and 5 mins after sales opened they were up on the viagogo website on offer .
they have allocated tickets for profiteering in resale .
they 've admitted it on a phone convo i have it recorded .
in my desperate attempt to obtain tickets for my two traumatised daughters i 've contacted viagogo and ticketmaster on twitter and were on bbc news , thousands got caught out like us .
in the end organisers did n't acknowledge us and we were seated in the very back of the cricket ground , would have seen concert better if we 'd stayed home and watched it on tv .
we were supposed to be near the stage .
never again i buy from viagogo !
ever .
there needs to be an investigation into how big promoters like live nation can have a huge monopoly by owning ticketmaster + secondary sites get me in + seatwave .
conflict of interest .
they give percentage of tickets direct to secondary sites + split profits .
pure greed .
like for every online purchase .
flights , hotels , oh hang on .
bigger problem than we thought .
doh
what purchases does anyone make online where delivery charges are not added on at the end !
author: Victoria Derbyshire

documents.title: house prices growth slows
text: house prices rose at their slowest annual pace in almost five years last month , figures from the halifax showed .
average prices rose by 1.8 % in the three months to february , compared with the same period 12 months earlier .
that was also lower than the 2.2 % rise for the three months to january and the weakest increase since march 2013 .
however , the halifax 's russell galley says low mortgage rates and an ongoing shortage of properties for sale , should continue to support prices in the coming months .
read more here .

documents.title: blackrock clients made £ 36m on carillion failure
text: clients of blackrock who shorted shares in carillion made £ 36m between 2013 and the company 's collapse this year .
that 's according to amra balic , a managing director at blackrock who is giving evidence to mps today .
shorting shares involves betting that the share price will fall .

documents.title: carillion accounts 'were not a good guide '
text: you might remember that back in january construction giant carillion went into liquidation .
the after-effects are still being felt and today investors in the firm are in parliament answering mps questions about the collapse .
murdo murchison , chairman of kiltearn partners said the audited accounts of carillion `` were not a good guide to what was going on '' .
mr murchison takes issue with accountants kmpg who say that carillion 's situation deteriorated very quickly .
he said that according to the accounts carillion burned through £ 850m in cash in just a few months , which seemed extraordinary to him .
`` there must have been prior issues that were not presented to investors , '' he said .

documents.title: the reddest of red carpets for mbs
text: diplomatic correspondent james landale has been taking a look at why saudi crown prince mohammed bin salman 's uk visit matters .
the crown prince is looking for international support for his internal economic reforms while at the same time trying to offer reassurance to nervous international investors .
and the british government is keen to transform a security and defence relationship into one that includes broader economic ties as well . ''

and as financial times news editor peter spiegel points out , there are plenty of ads in today 's papers to commemorate the visit ( as well as numerous fixed and mobile billboards in and around london ) :
the british press is brought to you today by the kingdom of saudi arabia .
# mbs

documents.title: trump advisor quitting pushes down asian markets
text: shares in asia fell on wednesday .
not helping confidence was the resignation of donald trump 's top economic advisor gary cohn .
mr cohn is a strong advocate of free trade and his departure has ratcheted up fears the us president will push ahead with protectionist tariffs and start a global trade war .
japan 's nikkei 225 index dropped 0.8 % to 21,252.7 points while in hong kong , the hang seng index fell 1 % to 30,196.9 .
meanwhile china 's main shanghai composite index was down 0.5 % at 3,271.7 .

documents.title: coca-cola plans first alcoholic drink
text: coca-cola is planning to produce an alcoholic drink for the first time in the company 's 125-year history - with an alcopop-style product in japan .
it is keen to cash in on the country 's growing taste for chu-hi - canned sparkling flavoured drinks given a kick with a local spirit called shochu .
chu-hi - an abbreviation for shochu highball - has been marketed as an alternative to beer , proving especially popular with female drinkers .
japan 's big drinks firms including kirin , suntory and asahi all have varieties of the drink , and continue to experiment with hundreds of flavours .

documents.title: the right ticket ?
text: business producer rebecca wearn has been taking a look at the murky world of ticket resale websites with a campaigner and a member of mumford and sons .
me & @ twitterid have looked at why secondary ticket sites are getting a wrist-slapping .
campaigner @ twitterid told us : joy went to complete panic .
the total cost was £ 1,421 '' she said today 's @ twitterid ruling is a good start
here 's the refund guidance
is it about bands getting cash ?
ben from @ twitterid says no - that secondary sites change who can afford to come to see live music & therefore the experience .
he told @ twitterid that the rule change is progress but more reform is needed for easy affordable ticket resales
sadly it also puts many fans off listening to the music , buying a ticket or coming to a gig ever again # vofv # fairgogo
author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: lookers on the right road
text: lookers , the uk 's biggest car dealership , says adjusted pre-tax profits rose 5 % to £ 68.4m following growth across all its businesses - particularly in used cars .
turnover rose 14.9 % to £ 4.7bn .

chief executive andy bruce called it a `` robust set of results '' , adding : `` against a backdrop of a 5.6 % dip in the new car market , we have seen strong momentum in used cars and aftersales . ''
lookers sells marques including aston martin , bentley , bmw , ferrari and , erm , vauxhall and volkswagen .

documents.title: ftse 100 moves lower , but rolls royce jumps
text: the ftse 100 is 0.4 % lower in early trading .
shares in paddy power betfair have tumbled 5 % after its annual results .
rolls royce has jumped 8 % after the engineering company reported a return to profit last year .
and restaurant group is up almost 7 % after the owner of frankie and benny 's announced better than expected results .

documents.title: cohn departs
text: as former goldman sachs bigwig gary cohn bids farewell to the white house , bbc business presenter louise cooper tweets :

documents.title: paddy power see 'bookmaker friendly results '
text: paddy power betfair has reported a 20 % rise in operating profit for last year to £ 392m .
strong growth in sports betting helped boost those figures .
`` the new financial year has started as 2017 ended , with sporting results favouring bookmakers .

this sustained period of bookmaker friendly results has , however , significantly affected customer activity , including reduced re-cycling of customer winnings , '' the company said in its annual results .

documents.title: restaurant group took 'decisive action '
text: despite the fall in sales at the restaurant group , analysts at liberum say the company is in a `` substantially better position '' now than this time last year .
the slightly better than expected results are a `` testament to management 's decisive actions '' .
however , they add : `` there is more to do with investment in technology , site refresh and acceleration in openings across pubs & concessions .
the market backdrop remains tough . ''
shares have fallen by a fifth in the past 12 months , leaving the company worth £ 477m .

documents.title: rolls boss explains jet engine problems
text: warren east is the chief executive of rolls royce , he explained why the company is taking a hefty charge related to its trent 1000 engine .
`` some of the parts in our trent 1000 engine are wearing out more quickly than previously forecast , '' he told the today programme .
`` it will take some years to fully implement the modifications to the engines which are in service at the moment . ''
however , he points out that the jet engine business is growing .
over the next few years , rolls royce engines will power half of the world 's wide-bodied aircraft .
rolls also makes engines for ships .
he says `` it is possible '' that part of that marine division could be put up for sale .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: dhl boosts deutsche post
text: we would n't normally bother with results from deutsche post , but it also owns dhl - the logistics group responsible for kfc 's recent chicken chaos in the uk .
the german firm says profits for 2017 rose 7.2 % to €3.74bn as online shopping boosted demand for parcel deliveries .
dhl delivered more than 1.3 billion parcels in germany for the first time last year .
`` dhl is benefitting from e-commerce , and we are confident we will see a strong continuation of that growth over the coming years , '' says chief executive frank appel .
it expects profits to rise above €5bn by 2020 .

documents.title: ofgem cuts bills ( a bit )
text: personal finance correspondent simon gompertz has been taking a look at this morning 's announcement from ofgem on energy prices :
ofgem 's cut in energy transmission and network costs would n't kick in until 2021 though
ofgem claim 17 % decrease in costs since mid 1990s .
however this is using rpi comparison and not cpi !
using cpi costs have increased .
story online so far not including this disclaimer ( which the ofgem press release does mention )
savings of about £ 20 a year on gas and elec bills promised by energy regulator ofgem , from squeezing grid and local network costs
oooooh what should i spend my windfall on

documents.title: rank boss joins shop direct
text: henry birch , chief executive of rank group , is jumping ship to run shop direct , which owns online retailers including littlewoods and very.co.uk .
mr birch , who joined rank in may 2014 , will stay with the gambling group for 12 months before becoming shop direct 's chief executive .

documents.title: rolls royce back in profit
text: rolls royce swung back into profit last year .
it made a £ 4.9bn profit , compared to a £ 4.6bn loss in 2016 when it was hit by the costs of settling corruption cases and adverse currency moves .
in 2017 rolls royce delivered 483 large jet engines , compared with 357 in 2016 .

it is taking a £ 230m hit on two of its new engines , the trent 1000 and the trent 900 , which have reliability problems , and there is a big hint that it will take out some more layers of management as part of a shake-up .

documents.title: restaurant group sales slide
text: the problems facing the casual dining sector in the uk are underlined by annual results from the restaurant group , which has almost 500 outlets in chains including frankie and benny 's and chiquito .
like-for-like sales fell 3 % for the 12 months to 31 december , while adjusted pre-tax profit fell from £ 77.1m to £ 56.7m .

chief executive andy mccue said the company had started 2018 `` with a significantly more competitive offering in our leisure business , a strengthened pipeline of growth opportunities in both our pubs and concessions businesses , and a leaner , faster and more focused organisation '' .

documents.title: ticket touting is 'sad '
text: the uk 's four biggest secondary ticketing sites - get me in , viagogo , stubhub and seatwave - are facing a crackdown by the advertising standards authority .
it says they have not been clear enough about extra fees added at the end of the booking .
ben lovett from mumford and sons tells the bbc that ticket reselling is skewing audiences at his band 's gigs towards those who can afford them .

documents.title: will london win saudi aramco float ?
text: saudi arabia 's crown prince mohammed bin salman arrives in the uk later for a three-day visit .
the 32-year-old 's trip comes as the kingdom prepares to float 5 % of the state-owned oil company saudi aramco .

alia moubayed of the international institute for strategic studies tells today the float is part of a drive to diversify the saudi economy away from oil amid persistently low oil prices , as well as cut spending and encourage more foreign investment to create jobs .
she says the float `` could be a game changer '' and be a `` big credibility issue '' not to go ahead with the plan .

exactly where the listing will take place is yet to be decided , but with saudi aramco worth north of $ 1 trillion city brokers will be hoping the uk 's charm offensive - which includes lunch with the queen - will tip the balance in london 's favour .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: business pages : p & g ad shock , gkn and smaller seats
text: let 's have a quick look at some business stories in today 's newspapers
the world 's biggest buyer of advertising , procter & gamble wants to `` take back control '' of its marketing , reports the financial times .
that would cut spending with advertising agencies by £ 2bn a year .
that would add to big cuts already made by p & g .
the times says that melrose is `` on the back foot '' in its effort to by uk engineering giant gkn .
bosses from both firms answered questions from mps yesterday .
melrose is now under pressure to make a legally binding commitment to preserve jobs and maintain investment in research , the article says .
british airways is introducing seats in its world traveller section that are 10 % smaller , according to page 10 of the telegraph .
that means there will be 10 seats in a row on its fleet of boeing 777 jets , instead of nine .
the new layout will be introduced next year on flights from gatwick to the americas , the telegraph said .

documents.title: weak finish to 2017 for australian economy
text: australia 's economy clocked up gdp growth of 0.4 % in the last quarter of 2017 - lower than expectations for growth of 0.5 % and marking a weak finish to the year .
consumer spending in the quarter came in at 1 % , which was stronger than expected , but a decline in exports for the three months to december dragged on growth .
full year growth came in at 2.4 % compared to a year earlier , down from 2.9 % .
analysts said the economy was running at below capacity but that the outlook was not all doom and gloom .
`` our view is that the australian economy will strengthen somewhat in 2018 as business conditions are still very positive , '' said shane oliver , chief economist with amp capital .
the central bank expects to see growth of 3 % in 2018 .

documents.title: brexit and financial services
text: the chancellor philip hammond is expected to set out his vision for a free trade deal with the eu later , which includes the finance services industry , saying that a `` bespoke arrangement '' between the eu and the uk on financial services is in everyone 's best interests .
`` equivalence is probably the best we 're going to get , '' says economist vicky pryce .
she explains that under that arrangement , european authorities will decide which products can be sold by uk-based firms into europe .
such approvals can be withdraw at any time she points out .
`` i really do n't think we have a lot of room for manouevre in this case , '' she says about the negotiation .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: gig tickets : resellers ordered to disclose fees
text: ben lovett from the band mumford & sons is unhappy with the way tickets are sold .
he says that people buying tickets just to sell them on can get greedy and end up not being able to sell them at all .
`` we think we 're going out on the stage to a sell out show and sometimes we 've had as much as 10 % of the crowd just are n't there , '' he told wake up to money .
many tickets for gigs are sold by secondary ticketing agencies and they are in trouble with the advertising standards authority ( asa ) over booking fees .
the uk 's four main secondary ticketing agencies have been banned from using certain `` misleading '' price strategies .
the asa said they had not been clear enough about extra fees added at the end of the booking .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: good morning !
text: welcome to wednesday 's business live page .
saudi crown prince mohammed bin salman begins a trip to london .
that will prompt discussion about the planned listing of the giant saudi oil company aramco - the london stock exchange has been hoping that it will choose london .
rolls-royce ( the engineering firm , not the car maker ) reports full year results , we 'll be hearing from the chief executive later .
and secondary ticketing agencies have been banned for slapping extra fees on at the end of the booking process .
author: Ben Morris
Business reporter
